metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16669 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
coders/wpg.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (heap-based buffer overflow and application crash) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file, related to theAcquireCacheNexus function in magick/pixel_cache.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16669` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.26-19
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.26-19
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.26-19
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.26-19
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.26-19
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-19').
